item.title: Minnesota activates National Guard after St. Paul cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz has activated the National Guard in response to a crippling cyberattack that struck the City of Saint Paul, the state's capital, on Friday. [...]

item.title: Russian airline Aeroflot grounds dozens of flights after cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Aeroflot, Russia's flag carrier, has suffered a cyberattack that resulted in the cancellation of more than 60 flights and severe delays on additional flights. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit SAP NetWeaver bug to deploy Linux Auto-Color malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers were spotted exploiting a critical SAP NetWeaver vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-31324 to deploy the Auto-Color Linux malware in a cyberattack on a U.S.-based chemicals company. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Edge now an 'AI-powered browser' with Copilot Mode
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has introduced Copilot Mode, an experimental feature designed to transform Microsoft Edge into a web browser powered by artificial intelligence (AI). [...]

item.title: French telecom giant Orange discloses cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Orange, a French telecommunications company and one of the world's largest telecom operators, revealed that it detected a breached system on its network on Friday. [...]

item.title: FBI seizes $2.4M in Bitcoin from new Chaos ransomware operation
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: FBI Dallas has seized almost 23 Bitcoins from a cryptocurrency address belonging to a Chaos ransomware member that is linked to cyberattacks and extortion payments from Texas companies. [...]

item.title: How attackers are still phishing "phishing-resistant" authentication
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Push Security
item.description: Think passkeys make you phishing-proof? Think again. Attackers are using downgrade attacks, device-code phishing, and OAuth tricks to sneak past modern MFA. See how Push Security shuts them down. [...]

item.title: Lovense sex toy app flaw leaks private user email addresses
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The connected sex toy platform Lovense is vulnerable to a zero-day flaw that allows an attacker to get access to a member's email address simply by knowing their username, putting them at risk of doxxing and harassment. [...]

item.title: Tea app leak worsens with second database exposing user chats
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Tea app data breach has grown into an even larger leak, with the stolen data now shared on hacking forums and a second database discovered that allegedly contains 1.1 million private messages exchanged between the app's members. [...]

item.title: Flaw in Gemini CLI AI coding assistant allowed stealthy code execution
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in Google's Gemini CLI allowed attackers to silently execute malicious commands and exfiltrate data from developers' computers using allowlisted programs. [...]

item.title: Endgame Gear mouse config tool infected users with malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Gaming peripherals maker Endgame Gear is warning that malware was hidden in its configuration tool for the OP1w 4k v2 mouse hosted on the official website between June 26 and July 9, 2025. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: macOS Sploitlight flaw leaks Apple Intelligence data
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Attackers could use a recently patched macOS vulnerability to bypass Transparency, Consent, and Control (TCC) security checks and steal sensitive user information, including Apple Intelligence cached data. [...]

item.title: Exploit available for critical Cisco ISE bug exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researcher Bobby Gould has published a blog post demonstrating a complete exploit chain for CVE-2025-20281, an unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability in Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE). [...]
